article_title: The Shocking Truth About Medication Errors

article_metadata.description: Let’s say a physician writes a prescription for Colchicine and accidentally orders “10.0 mg,” when he should have ordered “1.0 mg.” That’s a tiny decimal error, a mistake even the best doctor could make. But it can be catastrophic for the patient. The higher dose could cause Colchicine poisoning, similar [...]
article_metadata.author: Leah Binder
